detaileddescription.para: This function is called internally, usually applications don't need to use this function directly.
Finalize the plugin system and all loaded plugins.
This function is called internally, usually applications don't need to use this function directly.
Load a dynamic library and return its handle.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the handle or NULL

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a symbol in a library.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the symbol or NULL
FALSE if the handle exists but can't be closed

detaileddescription.para: Open a dynamic library and initialize the plugin.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the plugin handle or NULL

detaileddescription.para: Close the library handle and finalize the plugin.
This function finalize the plugin but it's not sure it closes the library handler.

simplesect.para: FALSE if the handler exists but can't be closed

detaileddescription.para: This function is usually called internally and user programs don't need to call this manually.
Lookup a symbol of the given plugin.
If the plugin is not loaded yet, then load the plugin.

simplesect.para: the pointer to the looked up symbol or NULL

detaileddescription.para: Calls a function of a plugin from within the interpreter.
If the plugin is not loaded yet, then load the plugin and call the requested primitive.

parameterdescription.para: method in which the primitive call has been requested

memberdef.argsstring: (SyxInterpState *es, syx_symbol plugin_name, syx_symbol func_name, SyxOop method)
memberdef.name: syx_plugin_call

detaileddescription.para: Calls a function of a plugin from within the interpreter.
If the plugin is not loaded yet, then load the plugin and call the requested primitive.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the function to be called
method to execute if the primitive fails or syx_nil
